name: Wulfpack
description:
Wulfpack is a single player naval warfare screen set in World War II.

The game is played over three phases. The player commands a destroyer and in the first phase they must patrol the Atlantic protecting convoys from submarine attack. This phase of the game continues until sufficient supplies have arrived in England for the invasion to begin. If too many ships are lost then the game ends. Once the destroyer runs out of depth charges it must return to port and it is the captain's / player's task to successfully dock the ship. There are twelve ships in the fleet and crashing into the harbour causes the ship to sink. If all ships are lost then the game is over.

Once sufficient supplies have reached England the second phase commences in which the destroyer assists in the D-Day invasion by bombarding the enemy defences while avoiding mines and friendly ships.

In the final phase, after shelling the defences the player must guide landing craft to the beaches. If sufficient craft land then the enemy surrender, if not the invasion fails.

The game can be controlled via the keyboard or the joystick and it has five levels of difficulty.
alsoFor: Amstrad CPC, ZX Spectrum | Combined View

shot.caption: The game's title screen. While this remains on screen the game scrolls a string of text between the two dark lines stating the importance of the convoy supply routes
Before the game can begin the player must select a difficulty level
It pays to start on the easy level because this game is no pushover
The Atlantic Convoy phase of the game. There are two convoys at sea, one going to and one returning from England. Collision with either costs a ship.
Every so often the screen changes colour indicating an attack by a U Boat. When it returns to normal the tonnage of supplies required in England will have increased
The destroyer is on the trail of a U Boat. The sonar screen, top centre, indicates range and direction
The depth indicator, top centre, changes colour when the U Boat is in range
This is the depth charge screen. Here the player decides what depths to set the charges for and then launches them
Only after the charges have been launched does the player get chance to see the submarine
These charges were set for 560 and the sub was not that deep. The sub will now sail away to the left and the destroyer will resume patrol
All charges have been used up so the destroyer must resupply. The panel in the top centre says it must resupply at Bristol
This is Bristol harbour. The player must guide their ship to the appropriate dock, helpfully marked with a big 'D'
gettingthe ship to the dock is not as easy as it looks. This is the last ship of the fleet and it's sinking
Game over and a dismal summary
Docked at the port of Boston. The black crane moves back and forth during reloading
Bombardment phase, after completing the supply phase. Apparently you can only hit the yellow/black boxes (one destroyed)
Beach head phase. The white LCTs appear in groups and must reach the shores one at a time
Beach head phase, one LCT has landed. Enemy fire also destroyed two of the bigger gunships, but they seem to be useless anyway
